p: The toxicity of carvacrol and thymol to arthropod pests and vectors can be due to different mechanisms. Research has suggested that carvacrol and thymol potentiate ligand-gated chloride channels in insect nervous system and probably act as neurotoxic insecticides [ 48, 61]. Furthermore, it was shown that thymol may work by blocking octopamine receptors, which are unique to insects and considered as an important target site for pest and vector control [ 10, 14]. On the other hand, the actual role of thymol and carvacrol to interact with the cholinergic system of insects cannot be neglected [ 62]. Instead, their interaction with the detoxification system of insects can be excluded [ 63].
